bullet_points: Review the course idea and objectives.
List the essential competencies and skills for business professionals to enhance productivity with ChatGPT tools.
Explicitly detail both hard competencies (e.g., tool proficiency, prompt engineering) and soft competencies (e.g., critical evaluation, communication, collaboration).
Ensure the analysis is thorough and actionable for course design.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Analyze the course idea to identify core competencies and skills participants should develop.

bullet_points: Identify what knowledge or experience participants should have before taking the course.
Specify any required familiarity with business operations, digital tools, or AI concepts.
Include clear examples and desired levels of pre-existing knowledge to ensure all participants are adequately prepared.
Break down the course into main modules.
Ensure modules build upon each other in a logical progression.
Briefly describe the focus of each module.
Include a brief timeline or session duration per module to fit within the 8-hour timeframe.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Propose 4-8 main modules that logically progress from foundational to advanced concepts.

bullet_points: For every module, provide a concise description of what it covers.
Write learning goals using action verbs (e.g., "Participants will be able to...").
For hands-on modules, specify expected outcomes for exercises (e.g., tasks or mini-projects).
Provide estimated durations for each exercise to ensure the course stays within the 8-hour limit.
sub_tasks.sub_task: For each module, write a description, key takeaways, and specific learning goals.

bullet_points: Compile all modules, descriptions, learning goals, key takeaways, and exercise durations into a clear, organized markdown outline.
Structure the outline with clearly separated sections: Introduction, Prerequisites, Module Details, and Summary.
Ensure the outline is comprehensive, easy to follow, and aligns with the course's overall objectives.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Write the full Course Outline in structured markdown format.
